startCreating: Start creating a measurement by adding points to the map

CWAsites.title: Marine/Meteorological Data Near Taiwan
CWAsites.cwaopendata: Central Weather Administration Open Weather Data

APIlayers.title: Satellite Image
APIlayers.allOthers: Due to the schedule or the server limitation, the images might update later by the provider. Please select another date or wait for a few minutes.
APIlayers.sla: Sea surface height above sea level (Sea Level Anomalies)
APIlayers.slaOthers:
Altimeter satellite gridded Sea Level Anomalies (SLA, i.e. sea surface height above sea level) computed with respect to a twenty-year (1993, 2012) mean.
The gridded SLA is estimated by Optimal Interpolation, merging the measurement from the different altimeter missions available.
APIlayers.adt: Sea surface height above geoid (Absolute Dynamic Topography)
APIlayers.adtOthers:
The Absolute Dynamic Topography (ADT, i.e. sea surface height above geoid) is the instantaneous height above the Geoid.
ADT products were derived from SLA data.
APIlayers.chlOthers:
Products were interpolated based on a multi sensors/algorithms approach to provide the best estimate.
This product provided one day after satellite acquisition.
APIlayers.instOthers: Updated daily with date D-18h to D+48h.
APIlayers.3dinst_thetao: Sea Water Potential Temperature Analysis and Forecast (+48h)
APIlayers.3dinst_so: Sea Water Salinity Analysis and Forecast (+48h)
APIlayers.dailyOthers:
New forecast for D-1 to D+9 every day. 
Data assimilation is run every Wednesday, a best analysis for D-14 to D-8 and an analysis for D-7 to D-1. The analyses are updated on every Thursday.
APIlayers.bottomT: Sea Water Potential Temperature Analysis and Forecast at Sea Floor
APIlayers.mlotst: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma Theta Analysis and Forecast
APIlayers.zos: Sea Surface Height Above Geoid Analysis and Forecast
APIlayers.3dwater_velocity: Sea Water Velocity Analysis and Forecast

Animated.title: Animated
Animated.msla: Surface Geostrophic Sea Water Velocity Assuming Sea Level For Geoid
Animated.info: Using 0-day delay preliminary map product, NOT final map product.

CwaSeaForecast.others:
Data range from D+0 00:00(UTC) to D+5 00:00(UTC) after daily update on 14:00(UTC+8). 
For example, data range from 11/15 00:00(UTC) to 11/20 00:00(UTC) on 11/15 14:00(UTC+8) update.

OdbData.title: ODB Data
OdbData.des_season: Spring: Mar-May; Summer: Jun-Aug; Autumn: Sep-Nov; Winter: Dec-Feb; Northeast Monsoon Season: Oct-Apr; Southwest Monsoon Season:May-Sep.

topo.description: This layer represents compiled bathymetric data from single-beam echo sounder survey by research vessels, supplemented by GEBCO's 15 arc-second bathymetric data. For further information or data acquisition, please refer to the data source website.

CTD.description: This layer consolidates data obtained from Conductivity-Temperature-Depth Profilers (CTD) aboard our research vessels. It presents averaged data (data count >=3 due to regulations) within each grid at various depths. For additional information or data acquisition, please refer to the data source website.
CTD.description2: You can customize parameter, season, data segment, color scales, data ranges, and layer opacity from the left panel. 'Data splitting' divides the data range and shows two colors when set to 0, indicating values above the maximum and below or equal to the minimum. The parameter defaults to its initial settings when first switched, but can be customized by the user thereafter.
CTD.description3: Clicking on the data grid on map creates a vertical profile plot. You can switch a second parameter for comparison from the left-side panel.
CTD.others: includes CTD API for GeoJSON format data.

gravity.description: ODB-compiled gravity data collected by OR1. For detailed information and application, please refer to the website below.

current.description: This layer combines data collected by Shipboard Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (SADCP) aboard our research vessels. It displays average data when the number of data points is >= to 3. For further information or data acquisition, please refer to the data source website.
current.others: includes SADCP API for GeoJSON format data.

sedCore.source: ODB sediment and core sampling site (Ch.)
sedCore.description: This dataset provides an overview of the sampling locations and methods for marine sediment and core collection by OR1. For further details, please contact the leader of the respective cruise.

mhw.description1:
Monthly global marine heatwave level map created by ODB.
Change the month on the calendar above to switch layer. May require an extended period of time.
mhw.description2: Figure above (modified from Hobday et al. (2018)) describes how levels were categorized. Please refer to the ODB Marine Heatwave website for detailed calculation.
mhw.description3: For detailed calculation methods and definitions, please refer to the ODB Marine Heatwave website. The website also provides API and data downloads monthly mean sea surface temperature (SST), SST anomalies, marine heatwave levels, and themal displacements at a global resolution of 0.25° x 0.25°.
mhw.nodata: There is no Marine Heatwaves data.

chemistryList.description:
This layer contains chemical sampling data stored in ODB, including sampling location, time, cruise ID, depth, and parameters.

Select data in certain spatiotemporal range.
The map shows all sites include ANY of the selected parameters and depths.
Each point on the map shows sampling location, sampling time, depth, cruise ID, and other measured parameters.

Bio.name: Name
Bio.source2: Detailed sources labeled on each point.
Bio.description1: The Bio-Ocean Database compiles Taiwan's marine trawling data. ODB dataset includes National Science and Technology Council (NSC) sponsored research projects, academic papers, researcher contributions, and global databases; Ocean Conservation Administration (OCA) dataset includes its sponsored research projects.
Bio.description2: Mouse hover shows sampling date, location, data source, and topic. Click to display species, and taxon rank. <group> means unidentified to the specific taxonomic group.
Bio.description3: To apply detailed data, please contact ODB technicians.

plastic.description1: This layer displays open data from NCEI and the Coast Guard Administration project integrated by ODB. It includes sampling time, location, method, concentration levels, and data source.
plastic.description2: The NCEI Marine Microplastics product provides access to aggregated global data on microplastics in marine settings.
plastic.description3: Project surveys by Ocean Conservation Administration (OCA), Ocean Affairs Council.

CPlanLayers.title: Cruise Planner (C-Plan) Layers
CPlanLayers.description:
C-Plan is a cruise planning tool provided by ODB.
The tool is designed for researchers to plane cruise missions on map and export tables for cruise application.
CPlanLayers.tip:
Enter saved C-key, if it is correct, cruise data would be displayed on map.
Click the C-key on top of the inputbox to move to the layer. Click the cross to close layer.

description.woa:
World Ocean Atlas (WOA) is a collection of ocean data provided by NCEI, NOAA since 1994.
The 'Long-term mean' described here indicates average of six decadal means from 1955 to 2017 in WOA 2018 dataset.
description.cmems: This is a Global ocean biogeochemistry hindcast dataset.
description.profile:
0~500m profile of selected longitudinal or latitudinal line.
Hovering over the graph shows the value of each point. 
x: Latitude or Longitude; y: depth; z: value; NaN: No data or land.
description.contour: Contour on each depth. Hovering over the line to show value.

account.title: ODB SSO
account.unauthorized: Please check user name and password
account.userNotValid: User name exist or contains invalid character(s).
account.pwdRule:
At least 6 characters.
At least 1 letter and 1 digit.
Can't be too similar to other personal information.
Can't be a commonly used password.
account.validChar:
Valid characters: 
Unicode letters (case sensitive), digits, @/./_/+/-

success.title: Succesfully Registered!
success.text: Please check email to activate account

fail.title: Something went wrong...
fail.text:
Please check if the password is too common or similar to any above information.
If you encounter any other problems, please contact us.

description.location:
Latest updated location of NOR1 (yellow), NOR2 (green), and NOR3 (red)。
Click update time on panel to move to the current location.
The locations are not in real-time.
Update frequency depends on the administration of each vessel and satellite network condition.
description.hist: Past cruise tracks of OR1, OR2, OR3, NOR1, NOR2, and NOR3.

CustomLayer.title: Add Layers
CustomLayer.disclaimer: Data formats varies, therfore connection is not guranteed.
CustomLayer.addUrlOption: Add WMS/WMTS Service URL to Options

alert.error: Please check options or contact ODB
alert.zoomLevel: The layer might not support this zoom level

description.addUrlOption:
1. Enter the complete OGC WMS/WMTS GetCapabilities URL or the base URL.
2. Click the 'Add' button on the right to add the URL below.
*Must support EPSG:3857 projection.
*Space and tab will be removed.
Examples:
KVP: https://gis.sinica.edu.tw/tileserver/wmts
RESTful: https://gibs.earthdata.nasa.gov/wmts/epsg3857/best/1.0.0/WMTSCapabilities.xml
description.serviceType: Select service type. Usually 'wms' or 'wmts' appears in URL.
description.layerKeyword:
Please enter the layer keyword.
A case-insensitive search will be conducted, and a wildcard character '*' can be used anywhere in the string for fuzzy search.
 If you leave the search field blank or use a wildcard character, all layers will be searched.
For example, searching for 'sea will find the layer named 'sea', searching for '*sea' will find layers that end with 'sea', searching for 'sea*' will find layers that start with 'sea', and searching for '*sea*' will find layers that contain 'sea'.
description.serviceUrl:
KVP is more prone to errors, it is recommended to use the RESTful format.
Please note that WMTS may fail to load tiles when the Z value exceeds the limit.
*Must support EPSG:3857 projection.

RESTful: Please change TileCol/x, TileRow/y, TileMatrix/Zoom/z (or equivalent) to {x}, {y}, {z}.
Example: https://gibs.earthdata.nasa.gov/wmts/epsg4326/best/MODIS_Terra_CorrectedReflectance_TrueColor/default/2012-07-09/250m/{z}/{y}/{x}.jpg

KVP WMS: Please remove BBOX.
Example: https://nrt.cmems-du.eu/thredds/wms/global-analysis-forecast-bio-001-028-daily?SERVICE=WMS&REQUEST=GetMap&LAYERS=chl&STYLES=&FORMAT=image%2Fpng&TRANSPARENT=true&VERSION=1.1.1&TIME=2023-03-09T12%3A00%3A00Z&SRS=EPSG%3A3857&WIDTH=256&HEIGHT=256

KVP WMTS: Please modify these 3 parameters TileMatrix={z}&TileCol={x}&TileRow={y})
Example: https://gibs.earthdata.nasa.gov/wmts/epsg3857/best/wmts.cgi?Service=WMTS&Request=GetTile&layer=MODIS_Terra_CorrectedReflectance_TrueColor&tilematrixset=GoogleMapsCompatible_Level9&style=default&TIME=2012-07-09&Version=1.0.0&TileMatrix={z}&TileCol={x}&TileRow={y}&Format=image%2Fjpeg
description.addWmsLayer:
Enter the layer URL and parameters directly to add the layer.
Please refer to the access method instructions to modify the parameters into the correct format.
description.addLayerSelector:
Add layers by searching through the dataset.
Note that some layers require datetime parameters, please set them using the datetime selector above (local time).
description.addImage1:
Enter the image URL to add a single image (short URLs not supported), and set the latitude and longitude bounding box .

Example:
In the example tab of
description.addImage2: (CWA Integrated Radar Reflectivity Map) find the URL:
description.addImage3: and the bounding box coordinates 118-124ºE, 20.5-26.5ºN. Enter them and click 'ADD LAYER' button.

draw.title: Add Shapes
draw.resolution: Spatial resolution: 15 arcseconds (varying with location, approximately 460 m at equator).
draw.info:
Capable of drawing continuous line segments, polygons, circles, and individual points, with the ability to edit and delete the graphics.
	Length and area values are derived from geodesic calculations using the WGS84 ellipsoid.
	The resulting values are for reference only.
	Due to the characteristics of the package, there may be slight discrepancies between the mouse click position and the final position.
draw.polyline:
Line Segments: Left-click to add consecutive line segments; connect points or click 'Finish' to complete.
	Use 'Delete last point' to undo the last point; 'cancel' to cancel the segment.
	Hover for info: 'd' for distance from the previous point, 'D' for total distance.
	Terrain profile displays when completing a segment or clicking a completed one.
	The profile features dotted lines for sections and coordinates, toggled by 'Toggle Annotation' in the top toolbar.
	Top toolbar enables actions such as saving, zooming, and panning.
draw.polygon:
Polygon: Left-click to add segments, click start or 'Finish' to complete.
	Hover for info: 'A' for area, 'p' for perimeter.
draw.circle:
Circle: Left-click and drag from a point to create a circle; release to complete.
	Hover for info at the center: 'r' for radius, 'c' for circumference, 'A' for area
draw.marker:
Single Point: Left-click to add a point.
	Hover for info: 'ele' for elevation.
draw.downloadDescription: Click button below to download all paths in corresponding format.
draw.downloadCaption:
*Not support for Circles.
*GPX does not support polygons.
*GeoJSON does not include elevation.

screenshot.title: Screenshot
screenshot.coord: Enter coordinates to define the selection range

info.selection:
In selection mode, the cursor becomes a crosshair, and the map cannot be dragged.
	The selection box disappears after moving or zooming the map.
info.input:
Enter coordinates to define the selection range. Click outside to activate selection mode.
	The latitude range is ±90, and the longitude range is -239 to +481.
info.download:
Download a screenshot of the selected area, or the entire screen if no selection is made.
 Incomplete layer loading results in an incomplete screenshot.

alert.fetchFail: Data fetching issue. Please wait or contact tech support.
alert.mhwNotInTime: Not in time range. Shown data are from the closest month.
alert.checkQueryParameter: Incorrect parameter, please check URL query string.

site.title: About Hidy
site.p1: This site is an integrated data display platform developed and maintained by the <0>National Science and Technology Commission's (NSTC) Ocean Data Bank (ODB)</0>. Its primary purpose is to showcase ODB's open data and other ocean data required by various sectors, including industry, government, and academia.
site.p2: ODB, established and operated by the <0>Institute of Oceanography, National Taiwan University</0> on behalf of the NSTC, dedicated to the primary mission of aggregating data from various domestic research vessels, including New Ocean Researcher <1>1</1>, <2>2</2>, <3>3</3>, Ocean Researcher 1, 2, 3, Fishery Researcher 1, and Ocean Researcher 5. We analyzes, organizes, and presents the accumulated investigation findings from these vessels over the years, providing data inquiries and applications within the national marine research community.
site.p3: Due to security requirements, this platform only displays processed data and does not provide data requests and downloads. If you have such needs, please refer to the <0>regulations</0> and <1>apply to ODB</1>.
site.p4: Google Chrome is recommended browser with a screen resolution of 1280x720 or higher for the best browsing experience. This site also supports Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari, and other browsers, but there may be slightly different from the original design. We do not recommend browsing on mobile devices (phones and tablets) as this site has not been optimized for a mobile experience.
site.p5: If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to contact us:

acc.title: About Account
acc.p1: ODB SSO is the single sign-on system for all ODB services.
acc.p2:
Registration: Click on the person icon in the upper right corner of this site, then select 'Create new account' at the bottom of the displayed panel, and follow the steps to create an account and verify your email. The personal information you provide is solely for system identification purposes.
**Administrative units, principal investigators (PIs), and others with special permissions granted by NSTC, please <0>contact us.
acc.p3: Login: Click on the person icon in the upper right corner of this site, and enter the username and password to log in. If 'Auto login' is not selected, automatic login will occur upon closing the browser. If selected, automatic login will be performed within a certain timeframe.
acc.p4: Cookies on this site are used to record account activities. Kindly remember to log out when finished using public devices. If the username and password are correct but logging in is unsuccessful, consider clearing the cookies or reaching out to us.

cite.other: If you are using the original data from this website, please follow the regulations set by the original data publisher
cite.api: *When citing the API, please modify the last URL to the API URL and version (please refer to the API documentation). eg., ecodata.odb.ntu.edu.tw/api/sadcp. v1.0.
